meanings.definition: A symbol (—) used in textual criticism to indicate a doubtful or corrupt passage.
meanings.sent1: The editor marked the questionable text with an obeli.
meanings.sent2: In the book, the obeli helped identify the uncertain parts.
meanings.sent3: The obeli in the manuscript made the scholars scratch their heads.
meanings.sent4: The obeli acted as a spotlight on the suspicious section.
meanings.sent5: The obeli stood out like a red flag in the text.

meanings.definition: A dagger-shaped mark (†) used as a reference mark in printing.
meanings.sent1: The obeli at the bottom of the page guided the readers.
meanings.sent2: Printers often use obeli to point to additional information.
meanings.sent3: The obeli on the paper looked like tiny swords.
meanings.sent4: The obeli pierced through the text like a sharp blade.
meanings.sent5: The obeli on the page were like little arrows directing attention.

meanings.definition: A mark used in ancient manuscripts to indicate a passage of doubtful authenticity.
meanings.sent1: The obeli in the ancient text hinted at possible alterations.
meanings.sent2: Scholars rely on obeli to flag uncertain sections in old writings.
meanings.sent3: The obeli in the manuscript seemed to whisper secrets.
meanings.sent4: The obeli cast doubt on the legitimacy of the passage.
meanings.sent5: The obeli were like caution signs in the historical document.
